results.title: Noddy be brave (K)
results.creator_credit: CPL, Stop Frame Productions, Brian Cosgrove and Mark Hall
results.brief_description: Based on the Noddy stories by Enid Blyton. Noddy is looking forward to visiting Big Ears on his day off, but a car accident means he must find alternative transport for his taxi service. While Noddy’s car is in the shop, Mr Honk from Car Town starts up his own taxi service in Toy Town. Noddy and Big Ears must devise a plan! Narrated by Richard Briers.

results.title: Noddy and the naughty tail
results.brief_description: Noddy and his friends have lots of fun in four exciting adventures. “Noddy loses sixpence”, but he isn’t the only one. Even the Pink Cat’s tail has gone missing! The Goblins trick Noddy out of his car in “Noddy and the goblins.” In “Noddy and the naughty tail” Bert Monkey sells his pencil case with his magic rubber and it falls into the hands of Mr. Tubby. Big Ears suggests that Noddy should hold his umbrella when driving in “Noddy and the pouring rain.” This delightful puppet animation is based on the characters created by Enid Blyton.

results.title: Noddy and Tessie Bear (K)
results.creator_credit: CPL, Stop Frame Productions, Brian Cosgrove and Mark Hall
results.brief_description: Based on the Noddy stories by Enid Blyton. Noddy helps Tessie Bear sell her eggs on market day after which they then buy a kite to fly in the strong wind, in a nearby farmer’s paddock. They tie the kite to a milk churn and a basket full of eggs, and the kite lifts the milk and eggs aloft raining milk and eggs on the market before eventually Noddy comes to the rescue. Narrated by Richard Briers.

results.title: Noddy's Toyland adventures
results.brief_description: Four adventures from Noddy and his friends in Toyland. 1.”Noddy loses sixpence” - Everyone’s losing things in Toyland today - the milkman’s watch, Dinah Doll’s new bag and the pink cat’s tail. 2.”Noddy and the goblins” - The goblins have tricked poor Noddy out of his car and hat. 3.”Noddy and the naughty tail” - Look out! Bert Monkey sold his pencil box, forgetting his magic rubber that rubs out everything it touches. 4.”Noddy and the pouring rain” - It’s raining in Toyland, and Noddy’s passengers are getting wet - until Big Ears has a good idea. Based on the stories by Enid Blyton.

results.title: Nobody will speak of us when we are dead = Nadie hablara de nosotras cuando hayamos muerto [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Flamenco Films SA, Xaloc SA, Renin, Edmundo Gil Casas and Agustin Diaz Yanes
results.brief_description:
Gloria turns to prostitution to support her alcohol addiction after her bullfighter husband is seriously injured. We first see Gloria on the job for a group of Mexican money launderers. Things go awry when one of the clients, an undercover DEA agent is murdered. Gloria is the only witness, and after a pique of generosity, is handed a list of contacts in Spain. Eventually deported, Gloria returns to Madrid, contacts in hand, to the home of her mother-in-law and invalid husband determined to start a new life but is pursued by one of the hitmen. An interesting subplot involves his daughter’s illness exacerbated by her father’s profession, seemingly as an act of God. Hailed as a Spanish “Pulp fiction”, “Nobody will speak of us when we’re dead” received the 1995 Goya Award for Best Picture. In Spanish with English subtitles.
Cast includes: Victoria Abril, Pilar Bardem, Federico Luppi

results.title: Nobody waved good-bye
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Roman Kroitor and Don Owen
results.brief_description: A story of teenage conflict - the predicament of a youth who rebels against his parents’ middle-class goals and conventions. Away from home and high school he finds the world a cold place to go it alone. Ideals are no defence when the need dor money leads to shady practices. This feature film is a study of the sources of delinquency in an affluent society, mirroring many of the problems and frustrations of young people. Cast includes: Julie Biggs, Peter Kastner, Charmion King, Ron Taylor, John Vernon.

results.title: Nobody told me
results.brief_description: So that “nobody told me” is no longer an excuse, the film carefully explains how floods occur and, also, the work of the Grand River Conservation Authority in Ontario, Canada, to police the flood plain regulation. The regulation itself is explained in great detail.

results.title: Nobody gets out of this band alive
results.brief_description: The Spinning Wheels were an Australian band that played in the mid 60s. They were heavily influenced by early Rolling Stones and took to playing covers by Muddy Waters, Bo Diddley, Chuck Berry and Jimmy Reed. Their version of Muddy Water’s ‘Got my mojo working” became a Top 10 Australian hit. Legendary radio disc jockey Stan ‘The Man’ Rofe said that the band paved the way for rock and roll’s popularity in Melbourne. However, the band failed to release an album until the year 2000. This video shows The Spinning Wheels playing two sets at their album launch at the Melbourne rock and roll venue The Tote. The show was compared by Rofe and features an excellent set by garage rockers The Breadmakers. The sound quality is OK and the picture quality plain as it is only one camera, however, fans of The Spinning Wheels, The Breadmakers, and of early Australian rock and roll would find this video worth checking out. No production details available.

results.title: Nobody ever died of old age
results.creator_credit: Henry Street Settlement, Films Incorporated and Herbert Danska
results.brief_description: Presents a series of character studies of what it is like to be old in America, as seen through the eyes of a young nurse and writer in both rural and urban settings. Reel two begins with a quick overview of the physiological signs of ageing. The film then examines the plight of old people, hospital treatment, old-age homes and accommodation in general. Good sharp dialogue used by main characters to highlight the plight of the unwealthy elderly.

results.title: Nobody's victim
results.creator_credit: Ramsgate Films, Self-protection Media for Women, Alan Barker and Vaughn Ohern
results.brief_description: Based on the book ‘Personal safety and self-defence for women’ by Pat F. Stock. Covers property and life saving precautions, and shows simple defence methods that every woman can use.
